Generation IV.Diamond: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
Generation IV.Pearl: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
Generation IV.Platinum: Its arms are made of plants that bind themselves to things. They grow back right away if cut.
Generation IV.HeartGold: When it remains still, it appears to be a large shrub. Unsuspecting prey that wander near get ensnared by its vines.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

Generation V.Black: Its arms are made of plants that bind themselves to things. They grow back right away if cut.
Generation V.White: Its arms are made of plants that bind themselves to things. They grow back right away if cut.
Generation V.Black 2: Even if one of its arms is eaten, it's fine. The Pokémon regenerates quickly and will go right back to normal.
Generation V.White 2: Even if one of its arms is eaten, it's fine. The Pokémon regenerates quickly and will go right back to normal.

Generation VI.X: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
Generation VI.Y: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

Generation VIII.Sword: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.
Generation VIII.Shield: Vine growth is accelerated for Tangrowth living in warm climates. If the vines grow long, Tangrowth shortens them by tearing parts of them off.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance. It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping them around prey to ensnare them.

Generation V.Black 2: Route 13 , Giant Chasm ( rustling grass ) Trade Mantine in Humilau City
Generation V.White 2: Route 13 , Giant Chasm ( rustling grass ) Trade Mantine in Humilau City

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Grand Underground - Swampy Cave , Bogsunk Cavern (After obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Grand Underground - Swampy Cave , Bogsunk Cavern (After obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Crimson Mirelands : Gapejaw Bog (also mass outbreaks nearby), massive mass outbreaks Cobalt Coastlands : near Crossing Slope (mass outbreaks) Alabaster Icelands : Space-time distortions
